page.title: 09Changes in West Taphouse
page.content: West Taphouse was a quiet hamlet which has been split by the A390 road.People once travelled by pony and trap or walked or cycled,but now most people travel by car or bus. Except for the two Council houses no houses have been built in the area since 1914. There used to be three shops in the village now there are none.The nearest shop is at East Taphouse.There used to be lots of Roundsmen but there are not many now. There have been no services in the old chapel for at least 20_25 years. The school used to take children from age 5_14.Now it is a primary school and takes children age 5_11.Children used to walk to school but now they are transported by bus or car. West Taphouse farm is a listed building.It is now a private house.
